title: Zelensky Pushes for EU and NATO Membership at Meeting in Moldova
description: “This year is for decisions,” President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine said at the European Political Community gathering, which sought to showcase Western solidarity amid the Kremlin’s war.

title: Spy Deaths on Boat in Italy Ignite Conspiracy Theories
description: Four people died when a storm sank a boat in northern Italy. Then it emerged that 21 of those aboard had worked for Israeli or Italian intelligence, igniting a speculative frenzy.

title: China Wants to Set the Terms of Any ‘Thaw’ With the U.S.
description: China has pushed to set the terms of its re-engagement with the Biden administration, rebuffing a request for a defense meeting while urging Washington to drop sanctions.

title: Senegal’s Opposition Leader Is Sentenced to 2 Years in Prison
description: A case involving a rape charge against Ousmane Sonko has monopolized the country’s political life and raised concerns over the prosecution of political opponents.

title: The Nonstop Work of Ukrainian Air Defenses: ‘We Have No Days Off’
description: Russian air attacks on Kyiv have come in relentless waves. Yet very little has penetrated the patched-together but increasingly sophisticated air defense network. Here’s why.

title: The House Passed the Bill. Who Won?
description: President Biden both won and lost the debt-ceiling negotiation.

title: Australia’s Most Decorated Soldier Loses War Crime Defamation Case
description: A judge rules for newspapers that had been accused of defaming the soldier by reporting that he had committed war crimes in Afghanistan.

title: Iceland Is a Magnet for Tourists. Its First Lady Has Some Advice for Them.
description: Eliza Reid, a former U.N. tourism ambassador and the wife of President Gudni Johannesson, welcomes her country’s many visitors, and has a few suggestions on safety, respect and how to meet locals.

title: China Investing in Open-Source Intelligence Collection on the U.S.
description: A new report outlines Chinese efforts to mine public information from the Pentagon, think tanks and private companies to gain insight on the American military.

title: Another Early Morning Strike on Kyiv Kills Three
description: At least one child was among the dead, local officials said. Russia has recently increased the pace and intensity of its strikes on the capital.

title: Conflict With the Far Right Shrouds Jerusalem’s Pride Parade
description: Much of Israel’s L.G.B.T.Q. community feels threatened by the right-wing government and its judicial overhaul plan — even with a gay speaker of Parliament.

title: Russia Strikes Kyiv, Killing 3 in Another Early Morning Attack
description: At least one child was among the dead, local officials said. Russia has recently increased the pace and intensity of its strikes on the capital.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Russia’s response to drone strikes on Moscow.

title: Russia Strikes Kyiv, Killing 3 in Another Early Morning Attack
description: Among the dead in were two children, the city’s mayor said. Russia has recently increased the pace and intensity of its strikes on the capital.
